articles.headline: K.K.R. Settles Over ‘Broken Deal’ Expenses
articles.snippet: The case is the first of its kind for the S.E.C., which has been closely scrutinizing private equity firms.
articles.abstract: The case is the first of its kind for the S.E.C., which has been closely scrutinizing private equity firms.
articles.lead_paragraph: For years, private equity firms operated behind a curtain of mystery when it came to how they passed along expenses to investors. The Securities and Exchange Commission is now beginning to pull back the curtain and shine a light on those practices.

articles.headline: Monetary Controls in Greece Squeeze Consumers and Businesses
articles.snippet: The restrictions will severely impair the functioning of the Greek economy, which is already in shambles after five years of crisis.
articles.abstract: The restrictions will severely impair the functioning of the Greek economy, which is already in shambles after five years of crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — The bank closings and restrictions on money transfers that the Greek government imposed on Sunday are the financial equivalent of a tourniquet. The measures may stop the bleeding, but they are hardly a cure and could do more harm than good.
articles.byline: By Jack Ewing and Landon Thomas Jr

articles.headline: Hillary Clinton Faces a More Liberal Democratic Fund-Raising Landscape
articles.snippet: Democratic fund-raising has become more ideologically aligned with the party’s liberal activists, according to a New York Times analysis of data collected by the Center for Responsive Politics.
articles.abstract: Democratic fund-raising has become more ideologically aligned with the party’s liberal activists, according to a New York Times analysis of data collected by the Center for Responsive Politics.
articles.lead_paragraph: Hillary Rodham Clinton will seek out donors to her presidential campaign from a Democratic fund-raising landscape vastly altered since her first presidential bid and far more ideologically aligned with the party’s liberal activists.
articles.byline: By Nicholas Confessore and Derek Willis

articles.headline: Obama Making Millions More Americans Eligible for Overtime
articles.snippet: The move by the White House restores the overtime threshold to about where it was in 1975 in terms of purchasing power.
articles.abstract: The move by the White House restores the overtime threshold to about where it was in 1975 in terms of purchasing power.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Obama announced Monday night a rule change that would make millions more Americans eligible for overtime pay.

articles.headline: Loads of Debt: A Global Ailment With Few Cures
articles.snippet: Beyond Greece and Puerto Rico, heavy borrowing is bogging down the economies of Brazil, Turkey, Italy and China.
articles.abstract: Beyond Greece and Puerto Rico, heavy borrowing is bogging down the economies of Brazil, Turkey, Italy and China.
articles.lead_paragraph: There are some problems that not even $10 trillion can solve.

articles.headline: The Hard Line on Greece
articles.snippet: Greece is in a standoff with the European Union, and everyone is trying to “war game” the outcome. Who is bluffing? The Greeks or the E.U.?
articles.abstract: Greece is in a standoff with the European Union, and everyone is trying to “war game” the outcome. Who is bluffing? The Greeks or the E.U.?
articles.lead_paragraph: In July 2012, Timothy F. Geithner, the United States Treasury secretary at the time, traveled to Sylt, an island off Germany in the North Sea.

articles.headline: Farm Waste and Animal Fats Will Help Power a United Jet
articles.snippet: Later this summer, United Airlines will begin using fuel generated from farm waste and oil from animal fats to help power its commercial flights.
articles.abstract: Later this summer, United Airlines will begin using fuel generated from farm waste and oil from animal fats to help power its commercial flights.
articles.lead_paragraph: Sometime this summer, a United Airlines flight will take off from Los Angeles International Airport bound for San Francisco using fuel generated from farm waste and oils derived from animal fats.
articles.byline: By Jad Mouawad and Diane Cardwell

articles.headline: U.S. Chamber of Commerce Works Globally to Fight Antismoking Measures
articles.snippet: The American trade group and its foreign affiliates pit countries against one another and lobby on behalf of the tobacco industry around the world.
articles.abstract: The American trade group and its foreign affiliates pit countries against one another and lobby on behalf of the tobacco industry around the world.
articles.lead_paragraph: KIEV, Ukraine — A parliamentary hearing was convened here in March to consider an odd remnant of Ukraine’s corrupt, pre-revolutionary government.
